column2: Nicole3, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: dianeisfrustrated, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Ernie, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

column2: NC_RRT, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: As a respiratory therapist & life long asthma sufferer,  I chose this inhaler in the 220mcg x 60 doses after cost & result comparison.  I found it more affordable for me since I have to pay out of pocket for any asthma preventative.  I am able to use just 1 puff a day so my 60 puff inhaler lasts 2 months at half the cost of other inhaled steroids.

column2: patient_zero, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Chronic sinusitis resulted from using the Asmanex Twisthaler for just three days.  Four weeks after discarding the inhaler, I am STILL in agonizing and debilitating pain.  Consultations with two physicians have proved futile in resolving this problem.  An appointment with an otolaryngologist is scheduled for next week.  A warning label needs to be added to this product regarding SEVERE adverse sinus reactions so that the patient can be alerted prior to using this medication.

column2: Tiffany, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am very satisfied with this inhaler. I was previously taking Advair. It has stopped working as well as before. I had developed nighttime asthma in addition to the asthma attacks during the day. I am proud to say I have not been woke up at all at night with asthma attacks any longer.

column2: Amard, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: KingBee, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: TBRADF8950, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

YOU CAN ALSO REMOVE THE TOP AND TAP THE UNIT UNIT ON A TABLE AND HARDLY ANYTHING OTHER THAN A FEW SPECKS COME OUT.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: cajunbrett, 65-74 Male  (Patient)

column2: jeandelancey@aol.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I developed asthma as an adult (I was a smoker for 13 years; my entire family smoked around me growing up) & was using a rescue inhaler many, many times a day.  I began using Asmanex about 2 months ago & have not used my inhaler even once in the last 3 weeks!  My thirst has increase but I chew a lot of gum & drink plenty of water to combat that.  I also have had weird, vivid dreams and a little trouble sleeping.  An even exchange for being able to breath in my opinion.Very easy to use:  twist the dial, inhale, replace the cap where the arrows line up.  There is a counter on the package for the doses remaining.  I always brush my teeth afterwards.I'm not sure if this type of steroid causes weight gain but in 2 months I have not gained/lost weight.  I have not really changed my exercise or eating habits.

column2: TINK, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)

Too many side effects and hoping there is no long term issues.

column2: Bigboy, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Sen, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Take Charge, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The end of April I was diagnosed with asthma for the first time in my life - only it was heart failure. People need to know doctors misdiagnose heart conditions as asthma and pneumonia. Don't take no for an answer - I did and ended up with Class III heart failure and a case of thrush.

column2: ZZP92, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I can breath again but now am having the same reaction I had before with the muscle pains.  I don't know what to do?? The worse part is the weight gain, and my doctor doesn't beleive is caused by the medication but I can't lose weight when I am on this medication. column9: This medicine works great whem my asthma is really bad and nothing else works. I've been on it off and on for the past year. I was on it for 2 weeks the very last time I used it and I gained 28 lbs in 14 days.  I've tried other steriod inhalers for my asthma, and none work as well as this one does for the asthma.  I'm hoping to find one that works for my asthma without the side effects, but so far this is all my doctor and I have been able to find that works for the asthma.  It's a difficult choice to make...be unable to breathe and have no mood probs or weight gain, or be able to breathe but be a bear to be around and have my weight balloon up way high.  I am normally a very calm person, but with this I feel out of control under the surface.  The anger is controlable with constant prayer. The only concern I have is that it tends to dry you out and leaving your chest feel tight in the morning.I live in Florida and the pollen has been rough lately so my breathing is not that good.  Although diagnosed with emphysema my doctor just recently put me on this Rx.  I am also taking Serevent and Combivent.I am going to talk with my doctor about adding Singulair as I used to use it several years ago and it worked real well.  Only because I believe I have allegery related problems too.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: At first it was hard to figure out how to use, but after figuring it out & realizing that I DID get the medication even though I thought I didn't, it works great. It is costly though, because I have no insurance. Another thing is I have experienced some "sexual side-effects" with this drug. Has anyone else had this problem?

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from asthma for a few years now and have been on several medications. this works the best and i have noticed a huge difference in sports preformance. this medicine realy works!!

column2: JOHN NADEAU, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: ? treatment for COPD

column2: Cryskv, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My son takes Asmanex and it has completely changed his life. There's no coughing, no wheezing. He feels like a new little boy.

column2: BKB, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Asmanex worked great to help me breath better, but I have experienced major joint pain, particularly in my knees.  I have now gone off the drug completely until I can be seen by my pulmonologist.  Has anyone else experienced this side effect?

column2: Eileene, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 8 weeks with bronchial coughing, I was referred to pulmonologist, who gave me Asmanex.  In less than a week, the coughing had almost disappeared.  Allergies still triggered congestion, but it didn't settle in my lungs while I was taking Asmanex.

column2: Joe, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used this medication for about one (1) one month. Although it worked pretty good on my asthma, I started having stomach problems (bloating & gas). I went off this drug, but my stomach problems continued for several months. Has anyone had stomach problems while on Asmanex? I'm thinking about trying it again. It did work well with my asthma!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After a few weeks I was really tight and had trouble breathing. I felt worse after taking it then before I started.

column2: cindy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have COPD and was taking Spiriva alone for awhile. My doctor prescribed Asmanex for my shortness of breath. It took 6 weeks for it to start to work but when it did Oh!How I could breath.

column2: Heather, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Asmanex has been very effective for me. I was using my fast acting inhaler several times a week. I was using the inhaler more often if I was working out, or when the seasons changed. Over the year and a half I have used Asmanex I have only had to use my fast acting inhaler twice.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was suffering a sinus infection with  fluid draining down my throat my it difficult to breathe.

column2: tia, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have COPD at times its hard to get around due to the climate I live in, (snow) I am breathing better, AND the critters I have are getting more hugs! Its hard getting use to new meds for a lot of us especially the fear of side effects. But I need to breath!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Because steroids inhibit your immune system, this drug made me break out like crazy so I had to stop using it!

column2: a54gemini, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This took 4 full days to really kick in but then I had amazing relief of bronchial asthma brought on by bronchitis.  The asthma is now gone after 2 weeks.

column2: jacki, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had used Advair prior to this product. I too am not sure if I am getting the medicine and find it very fustrating to figure it out. I think I will go back to Advair.

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Pmet, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started by taking one dose of this medicine, which was not very effective.  However, after progressing to 2 doses a day, it seems to be working with none of the side effects of other asthma controlling drugs I have been on.  The cost is mostly covered by my insurance so that isn't bad for me.  I have no problems with it.

column2: ssweet, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: dry and tightness of airways

column2: Sconnie, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prior to being prescribed the Asmanex twisthaler, I was using my rescue inhaler much more than prescribed...before bed, during the night, in the morning, etc.  Since I began using Asmanex (almost 3 weeks ago), I have yet to have to use my rescue inhaler and I sleep through the whole night without issue.The only problem I have had with this product is that when you first use it, even with the directions they provide, its hard to figure out if you are using the product correctly.  It would have been a lot easier had either the doctor or pharmacist given me a quick primer on how to properly use this product.  With all of the new dry powder inhalers making there way onto the market, each with their own device for delivering the drug, better steps should be made to show the patients the correct way to use each one.  Other than this issue, I am completely happy with Asmanex.

column2: Joanna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Twist cap can be tricky to use at first. Has helped with coughing & wheezing. Very expensive drug.

column2: palenakal, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had problems with ease of use.  It was hard for me to twist and pull cap off of the medication AND receive the medication in a timely manner.
